t: Matthew 8
Jesus Heals a Man With Leprosy
When*p Jesus came down from the mountainside, large crowds followed him.
A man with leprosy came and knelt before him and said, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
Jesus*p reached out his hand and touched the man. “I*r am*r willing,”*r he said. “Be*r clean!”*r Immediately he was cleansed of his leprosy.

Then Jesus said to him, “See*r that*r you*r don’t*r tell*r anyone.*r But*r go,*r show*r yourself*r to*r the*r priest*r and*r offer*r the*r gift*r Moses*r commanded,*r as*r a*r testimony*r to*r them.”*r
The Faith of the Centurion
When*p Jesus had entered Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking for help.
“Lord,” he said, “my servant lies at home paralyzed, suffering terribly.”
Jesus*p said to him, “Shall*r I*r come*r and*r heal*r him?”*r
The*p centurion replied, “Lord, I do not deserve to have you come under my roof. But just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
For I myself am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and that one, ‘Come,’ and he comes. I say to my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”
When*p Jesus heard this, he was amazed and said to those following him, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r I*r have*r not*r found*r anyone*r in*r Israel*r with*r such*r great*r faith.*r

I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r many*r will*r come*r from*r the*r east*r and*r the*r west,*r and*r will*r take*r their*r places*r at*r the*r feast*r with*r Abraham,*r Isaac*r and*r Jacob*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r
But*r the*r subjects*r of*r the*r kingdom*r will*r be*r thrown*r outside,*r into*r the*r darkness,*r where*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.”*r
Then*p Jesus said to the centurion, “Go!*r Let*r it*r be*r done*r just*r as*r you*r believed*r it*r would.”*r And his servant was healed at that moment.
Jesus Heals Many
When*p Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw Peter’s mother-in-law lying in bed with a fever.
He touched her hand and the fever left her, and she got up and began to wait on him.
When*p evening came, many who were demon-possessed were brought to him, and he drove out the spirits with a word and healed all the sick.
This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah: “He*pn took up our infirmities and*ld bore our diseases.”
The Cost of Following Jesus
When*p Jesus saw the crowd around him, he gave orders to cross to the other side of the lake.
Then a teacher of the law came to him and said, “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”
Jesus*p replied, “Foxes*r have*r dens*r and*r birds*r have*r nests,*r but*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r no*r place*r to*r lay*r his*r head.”*r
Another*p disciple said to him, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
But*p Jesus told him, “Follow*r me,*r and*r let*r the*r dead*r bury*r their*r own*r dead.”*r
Jesus Calms the Storm
Then*p he got into the boat and his disciples followed him.
Suddenly a furious storm came up on the lake, so that the waves swept over the boat. But Jesus was sleeping.
The disciples went and woke him, saying, “Lord, save us! We’re going to drown!”
He*p replied, “You*r of*r little*r faith,*r why*r are*r you*r so*r afraid?”*r Then he got up and rebuked the winds and the waves, and it was completely calm.
The*p men were amazed and asked, “What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the waves obey him!”
Jesus Restores Two Demon-Possessed Men
When*p he arrived at the other side in the region of the Gadarenes, two demon-possessed men coming from the tombs met him. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.
“What do you want with us, Son of God?” they shouted. “Have you come here to torture us before the appointed time?”
Some*p distance from them a large herd of pigs was feeding.
The demons begged Jesus, “If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”
He*p said to them, “Go!”*r So they came out and went into the pigs, and the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the lake and died in the water.
Those tending the pigs ran off, went into the town and reported all this, including what had happened to the demon-possessed men.
Then the whole town went out to meet Jesus. And when they saw him, they pleaded with him to leave their region.
